He goes to open the window but it is stuck. He tries again - but it won't budge. He looks around the room, then up at the now fully contracted blind. Tentatively he reaches up and pulls the cord to lower the blind a little. It slowly starts to unravel and unravel...and unravel, until it hits the bottom of the window sill with a gentle thud. dialogue.raw_text: So why aren't you at the wedding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, that's better. I knew something was missing. (shouting over the din) I had to get back for a work thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over the din) A work thing. For the job you just lost?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over din) I see. (beat) So, this job you lost. You liked it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over din) Yes. (beat) No. Not really. They've beaten it out of me. But its what i do - did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) I'm a composer. (stops himself) I write jingles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Uh...Uh... (long beat) Well, maybe, I mean it maybe before your time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singsong voice) You can take the Salem out of the country - but you can't take the country out of Salem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over din) Did you always want to write jingles or was there something more?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I just love the way you...you just cut through it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take that as a compliment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should. (beat) I was going to be a Jazz pianist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, I can be nosey. I tend to blurt stuff out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I like it. I like it... (beat/over din) ...Alot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a relief to find someone in this country who actually says what they feel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all changed. We're a nation changed. Ever since Diana, we've unlocked ourselves. Everything's flowing out. (beat) You guys showed us the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just as we're trying to adopt your stiff upper lip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is a stiff upper lip, exactly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I think, it's more this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (top lip stretched) Yeah you're getting there. Stretch it out further.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, now you're doing a bulldog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, now you look like you don't have any teeth. (beat) Are they your own?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dad had a front one that you could just take out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate exit the restaurant. They stand opposite each other in the quietening Terminal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slightly awkward pause. Kate glances at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey hadn't really thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shake hands, smiling. Just then Kate's phone rings again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate turns and leaves. Harvey watches her go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I should get going. I have a class.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a bit sheepish) Yes. A...writing class. (beat) Twice a week. Just something I do. (changing the subject) (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take the Heathrow Express. What about you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I guess I'll stay in a Hotel near here. My flight's in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey picks up a hotel phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like a room please. (beat) One night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kate waits on the platform as a train glides into the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate stands in a crowded middle section. A mild commotion ensues down the other end of the carriage as somebody squeezes aboard at the last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks up to see Harvey making his way down the crowded carriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People reluctantly make way for Harvey and his case. He finally arrives next to Kate as the train jolts forward. Momentarily losing his balance, Harvey steadies himself on a businessman's shoulder. Kate leans forward to help, as the businessman turns slightly irritated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate nods. Harvey smiles a little sheepishly as the train speeds off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry. (turning to Kate) Hi. (a little sheepish) I thought i might as well stay in town. More fun than a hotel next to a runway, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The train speeds past on its way into London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate stand next to each other, gently swaying, in the crowded carriage. The businessman standing next to Harvey, talks loudly on his phone about his day's conquest. Harvey and Kate share a look. In a Keatonesque performance, Harvey, keeping his body rigid, slowly leans further and further away from the man, making Kate smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train pulls into the station. We watch as Harvey and Kate alight with the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come to a stop outside. It's still light. A beautiful fall afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks towards the Taxi rank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Taxi's are over there. They'll take you to wherever you need to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, I guess it's goodbye again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (looks up at the evening sky/beat) So, I couldn't walk you to your class, could I? (beat) Carry your books? (beat) Stand near the curb so you don't get splashed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Montage: Accompanied by a wonderfully romantic little ditty, we watch from a distance as Harvey and Kate navigate the buzzing streets of central London. All is alive and well. Harvey drops his suitcase off at the same hotel he was staying in before. As they wander through the city, foreign students mingle, policemen chat, and office workers linger. London is at its best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky glows a pale orange as Harvey and Kate walk and talk along the South Bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Harvey a moment, then smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks at Kate quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then Kate's phone rings again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come to a stop as Kate takes out her phone and looks at the handset display.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey smiles. We hear Maggie's warble continue as Kate listens. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks at Kate. Kate shakes her head. Maggie continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kate hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start walking again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate comes to a stop and looks at Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks up at a grey municipal building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey shrugs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yours is a beautiful city, Kate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Its just a funny way of saying it. Quite old fashioned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But i like it. (beat) Yours is glorious country, Honeychurch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a line from a book. `Room with a View'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm not much of a reader. (beat) Too fidgety, I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, we're just quite different, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Both our phones ring a lot. We have that in common.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry. I should probably take this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mum? (beat) I've been busy. (beat) No, I'm out. Yes with someone. No someone else. (beat) Yes. (looks at Harvey) ...a man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did, did you? (beat) An actual body.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mum. Listen. I'll come over tomorrow and we can check it out together. (beat) I have to go now. Just get an early night and i'll see you tomorrow. (beat) I love you too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And herself. (beat) She's convinced she's living next to Poland's answer to Ted Bundy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She means well. She's just had a tough run. (long beat) My Father ran off to France with his secretary. Then mum got cancer, about four years ago now. She's fully recovered. But won't admit it. (beat) She's basically bored. And my continued `situation' as she calls it, being single, is her major distraction. Her pastime if you will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, my rotting eggs are her raison d'etre. (grimaces/turns to Harvey) Sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmm. (beat) Well, here we are. My class.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I wait? (beat) Sorry - I promise I'm not `Bundyish'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) It's getting cold. You don't want to wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling and backing towards the building) Careful, I might get the wrong impression.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Maggie, very tentatively, lifts her curtain again. No sign of the `Killer'. Suddenly the doorbell rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Maggie, slowly approaches the front door, the doorbell rings again. She slowly leans in and peers through the peep- hole. POV: The Neighbour looms large. He holds in his arms a large `something' wrapped in paper. Maggie pulls her head away. Beat. She looks again. POV: The Neighbour bends down out of sight and then rises again, turning to leave. Maggie watches him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door slowly opens. Maggie looks around then notices the `thing' wrapped in paper on the ground. She quickly picks it up and takes it inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As daylight fades, Harvey sits waiting. Through a large ground floor window, he watches Kate, as her class wraps up. As she comes out, he gets up and joins her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, the usual. (beat) Lovely mild-mannered Mike read us the latest installment from his Physcho-Sexual Thriller, and we all tried to look at him in the same way after.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate walk under Waterloo bridge past the second hand bookstalls. A man plays a saxophone melancholically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles, coming to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then a sort of Skiffle come Rockabilly busking act starts up. Two girls and a guy. They're great! Harvey and Kate stand amongst the crowd watching. The South Bank is at its vibrant best.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you ever wish you could try a different life? (beat) Just for a day. Just to see what it would be like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks down at her uniform) Well, no green, that's for sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat/thinks) It would take place in Spain. A little house inland.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what would you do there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh...I don't know... (beat) Write the great novel. (beat) I think I've got one inside me. We're not talking high art. Just a bloody good holiday read.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok. So this house in Spain would have a little cabana looking out over the plains for you to write in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And a little stream running by, to bathe in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm there. (beat) Sorry, that's if you're receiving guests.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, you can visit Harvey Shine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With the sound of the Skiffle act still playing in the distant background, Harvey and Kate take a seat on some steps over-looking the river. As darkness descends, street-lamps reflect off the water. They sit in silence. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Harvey shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Harvey looks out over the Thames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Harvey's sad profile. Beat. She thinks for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey shakes his head again. Kate is not about to give up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate momentarily blushes, then shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happened Harvey? (beat) Between you and your daughter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. (beat) Somewhere along the way I lost her. I lost my family. (beat) I just woke up one morning and realised i didn't belong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd always had this mean little feeling in my stomach, that they were a bit embarrassed by me. (beat) If you saw them now, with Brian, Susan's step-father. You'd see, they make more sense. They look right together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've not been a great father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The reception. It's still going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are you doing here? You must go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop feeling so sorry for yourself. She's your daughter, you're her father. Go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harvey, it would be unforgivable not to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait. I'm thinking. (beat) Only if you come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, come with me. As my...bodyguard. (smiles) As my friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harvey, firstly, i'm not about to go to anyone's wedding in a green polyester work suit. Secondly it's not right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll find you a dress. If we find you a dress, will you come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Music/Montage: The song is the same as that played by the buskers. It's a fast, fun Rockabilly Skiffle thingy. We watch as Harvey and Kate buy a dress. (Handheld/Double speed).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taxi pulls up and out step Harvey and Kate. Kate looks fantastic on Harvey's arm as they walk up the front steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A reception is in full swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors close behind Harvey and Kate as they enter an elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate stand side by side in silence. They both smile a little anxiously - almost like teenagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a loud `ping' as the   elevator doors open onto a hallway. Harvey and Kate step   forward. Down the hall, through some double doors we hear the   familiar din of a buzzing reception. Harvey momentarily   falters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate encourages Harvey forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors open and Harvey and Kate enter. Heads turn. Jean looks up and sees Harvey with Kate. She shakes her head. Susan sees Harvey and gets up. She joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off Susan's look, Harvey turns to Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slightly awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan looks back at the full top table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pete, acting as Master of Ceremonies, stands and clinks his glass for attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan heads back and resumes her seat at top table. The best man takes the mic...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm really sorry to gate-crash. Your father sort of insisted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's fine. I'm sure... (looks around) ...there's room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You get back. Don't worry about us, we'll find a place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. (stops a passing waiter) Could you find them a seat please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now for the best man's speech. Except we seem to be missing the bride. (laughter) Oh, no, here she is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The waiter leads Harvey and Kate to a table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter shows them to a few empty seats at the children's table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate take their seats. The kids stare at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brace clad, large girl in a white frilly dress speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate feels someone's eyes on her and turns to her left to find a smartly dressed young boy of about eight, staring up at her with his mouth open. Kate nods her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy remains silent, keeping his gormless gaze fixed on Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid this is the only place left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. (beat) You're not Miriam's kid are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow...You've...got big. I mean grown up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you're not to dominate the conversation tonight. (turning back to Harvey) Chatterbox to my left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: So without further ado, I'd like to propose a toast to Susan for making my friend Scott complete. The audience whoop and clap. Scott gives his best man a hug. Pete stands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More clapping as Brian stands. Kate glances at Harvey, who blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey suddenly stands and clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody really hears. He picks up his glass and a spoon and begins to tap it. People stir and turn to Harvey. Brian comes to a stop. Jean looks on furious. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone stares at Harvey. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A waiter brings Harvey a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's arrival slightly throws him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey continually knocks the mic against his chest, causing terrible feedback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Harvey drops the mic. Jean stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. Harvey stares out at the party. They all stare back at him. He glances down at Kate who smiles back. Harvey lifts the microphone up off the table and raises it to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People start to clap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Scott share a look. The room applauds loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Brian nods to Harvey, before standing and raising his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone claps loudly. Susan shares a gentle smile with her Father. Harvey sits and looks at Kate anxiously. Kate smiles and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She indicates to the rest of the table. Harvey turns to their now animated young neighbours, who all sit clapping.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And now ladies and Gentlemen. It is the turn of the Father of the Bride to say a few words. (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT'D) And tonight that task will be carried out by the very charming and distinguished Brian.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's quite some speech Josh. Quite something to follow. But I shall try...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you see I can't just sit hear and watch somebody else give my baby girl away. Susan's my daughter and I'm her father. Not the best, by far, but her father all the same.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um... I should have prepared something but... I guess it reminds me of a joke...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For God's sake Harvey, don't make a scene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No Jean. I want to make a scene. You know. I'm tired of being embarrassed. (beat) If we can't make a scene on the day of our daughter's wedding, then when can we? I want to make a scene. I want to shout! I wanna tell the world how lucky it is to have our Suzie in it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanna tell Scott, how damn lucky he is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) And also if he ever hurts her, I know people in north of London.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seriously though. Scott, I swear you have found in Susan a bright and passionate person. And a loyal friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I can see from the way she looks at you. From the way she is with you, that she is... (beat) (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...happy. (beat) And I thank you and welcome you to the family.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And finally, if I can linger a moment longer. I would like to turn it back over to Brian, with a note of... gratitude. (beat) Thank you for being there for my baby girl. Thank you for being there, when I wasn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you would all please join Harvey and I, in a toast. (beat) To Susan and Scott.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the first dance. The BAND strike up as Susan and Scott take to the dance floor. They dance a slow dance. Harvey and Kate sit watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . After a while Susan, looks over for her Father. Harvey hesitates, before Kate encourages him up. She plucks a flower from the table display and places it in his lapel. Harvey joins Susan and Scott on the dance-floor. Shaking Scott's hand, he leads Susan into a dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks on, as Harvey dances happily with his daughter. Feeling something, she turns to find the eight year old's head slumped against her shoulder as he sleeps soundly. Kate smiles at her lot. Back on the dance-floor, Harvey encourages Brian to take over the dance with Susan. Harvey turns away and is joined by Uncle Fred and gang. They all chat animatedly. Uncle Fred pushes Harvey into a dance with his wife. A `Boogie' strikes up. Kate looks on as Harvey dances and reunites with his extended family. She sees the delight in his face. She looks around at all the happy faces. It's time perhaps to let the family celebrate alone. Extricating herself from the sleeping boy, she pushes two chairs together and makes a bed for him. Covering him in a jacket, she glances back at the dance-floor before turning to leave. Back on the dance-floor, a `Boogie' is in full swing. Harvey caught up in the fun, energetically swings Aunt Maddie around. He suddenly catches himself and turns to his table to look for Kate, but finds it empty save for a row of dozing children. Harvey makes his excuses and turns away, looking for Kate amongst the crowded room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate retrieves her coat and makes her way down the hall towards the bank of elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey hurries to the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On turning into the hall, he sees Kate standing in the distance. Just then, she steps forward and out of sight. Harvey runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate stands in the empty elevator, waiting for the doors to close. She stares at her feet. Just then we hear a burst of a piano being played. It stops. Kate looks up to see, across the hallway, in an empty conference room, Harvey seated at a grand piano. He smiles a showman's smile before giving it another `old school' burst. He stops again. Kate smiles. Just then the doors begin to close. Kate reaches forward and presses a button - opening them. Harvey starts up again - but this time he plays something sincere - beautiful. Kate listens before slowly stepping out of the elevator. She walks towards him, joining him at the piano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey slides along the seat and indicates for Kate to join him. She does so and listens as Harvey plays beautifully. He's good. He finally brings the piece to an end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey smiles at Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They share a little smile. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks quizzically at Kate. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They share a look, before both looking away. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then a vacuum cleaner sounds. They both look up - as a cleaning lady vacuums the floor nearby. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the background we hear clapping and cheering coming from the reception. A funky number starts up. Harvey takes Kate's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey leads a slightly reluctant Kate back down the hall towards the reception.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You are very kind. But...no. (beat) Shearing doing Rogers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah. (beat) Well...you play it very well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bows his head a little/with a smile) Well, thank you Ms. Walker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should be with your family, Harvey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, you know, maybe I want to be with you. (beat/sings) You make me happy - when skies are grey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey kid, they're playing our song.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Come on. I want you to meet people. I want them to meet you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The band let rip on a funky tune. The congregation fill the dance-floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Harvey leads Kate back into the room and heads straight for the dance-floor. As they pass relatives along the way, Harvey introduces them to Kate. Much hugging and kissing ensues. Harvey and Kate dance a boogie. Uncle Fred and Aunt Maddie join them. Uncle Fred steals Kate from Harvey and twirls her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fun and Frolics on the dance-floor. Harvey is at the center of it all. He initiates a Horah. A Congo line. Russian dancing! Kate's face says it all - she's having a ball. The sleeping kid, sleeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close up on the M.C.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen. The bride and groom are about to leave. Please join me outside to send them off in style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate join the rest of the congregation outside on the steps of the hotel. Harvey looks on as his daughter and son-in-law head to an awaiting car. Susan stops and throws the bouquet behind her. It is caught by Aunt Maddie, who in turn throws it and it is caught by Harvey's `all grown up' niece. She blushes profusely revealing an impressive set of braces on her teenage teeth. Susan kisses her mother and Brian goodbye. And is about to get into the car when she stops and hurries over to Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hugs him tightly. Pulling away she turns to Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate nods as Susan turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kate smiles. As the car pulls away, everyone   cheers. Harvey looks on. His eyes momentarily lock onto his   ex-wife's. They share a conciliatory look. As Harvey watches   his daughter's car disappear down the street, Kate looks at   him. He turns back. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Harvey looks around.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna get out of here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate walk. The streets are quiet. There is already a hint of dawn in the sky. Rubbish trucks manoeuvre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn into the courtyard of Sommerset House and take a seat on some chairs. The sky lightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stare out over the courtyard. Silence. Harvey looks at Kate for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks back at Harvey and tries to read him. She looks down at her lap, then up, out over the courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun begins to creep above the buildings. Harvey and Kate look out across the courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks at Kate in the morning light. Kate blushes and looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks away, then back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles, determinedly trying to keep it light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate's blush deepens, she looks away and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate glances at Harvey, trying see the truth in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate can't help but smile. Beat. She glances towards the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate looks at Harvey, then again towards the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles a little smile. She suddenly believes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She steps backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey gets up and joins her. They look at each other. Harvey suddenly leans in and kisses Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate reaches for her purse and pulls out a photo. She gives it to Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and leaves, hurrying to catch a bus. Harvey stands holding an old library card. He looks down. On it is a faded photo of toothy young girl, no older than eleven. Harvey looks up and smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think I've stayed up all night since I was a student.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I don't know. My uniform's green?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was pregnant once. (beat) I didn't have it. Didn't give it a moment's thought. (beat) That's what smart girls did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do sometimes wonder what they'd be like today. (beat) Whether they'd be smart. Funny. Serious. (beat) I don't know, it's silly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know why i just told you that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly here, at these chairs. At noon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to leave. (beat) Guess why.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You say that now, but wait until tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harvey we know nothing about each other. You're...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A bit older, yes. (beat) I can be mean. Really mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know enough to know, I'll be here. Waiting, at this chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Noon. I mean it. (beat) I'll be here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I have something until tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kate takes a seat on the top deck of a bus. Taking a moment to catch her breath, she looks out the window. Turning back, she allows herself a smile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FADE IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey, with a croissant lodged in his mouth and a cup of coffee in hand, buys a morning paper. He turns and crosses the road, skipping up the steps of his hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey enters, and waving to a slightly bemused concierge, heads to the bank of elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey glances at the sign, then over to the stairwell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid they're both out of order, Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey, a man, seemingly impatient to start a `new life', runs up the steps. Surprised at first by his agility, he begins to slow. He stops to catch his breath. Suddenly his spare hand holds tight onto the bannister. Unsteady Harvey sits down. Close up on Harvey's face, confused. He tries to stand but again is forced back down. He begins to place his coffee on the stair next to him, but suddenly shudders, grabbing his shoulder. The coffee topples, spilling down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frightened and confused, Harvey sits alone in the stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Just then, a door opens and the African porter from before, comes through, carrying a tray. He sees Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks up in a daze, then shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate, with a skip in her step, walks through the bustling mid- day streets of London. She stops off and buys a bag of cherries from a `Fruit & Veg' vendor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the porter and concierge talk to a medic, Harvey sits in the back of an ambulance. The door is closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate sits waiting, expectantly, on the same chairs they had sat on earlier. She applies some lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey sits attached to various monitors and such, surrounded by doctors and nurses. He looks agitated and confused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got to go. I've got to be somewhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I need you to stay calm. It looks to me like Arrhythmia - an irregular heart-beat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, S.V.T'S, that's what I've been trying to tell the nurse. I've had it since I was a kid. I take Primax. I guess i've been forgetting to take it recently. I've been under alot of stress, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well Ok, then we probably know where we're at. But I need to check all possibilities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As time passes, we watch as Kate's expression slowly turns from expectant to resigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's Arrhythmia! Please, I have to be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As another pad is attached to his chest, Harvey looks beaten.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I'm 99% sure it is. But my job is to make sure it's not that 1%. I wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't check out absolutely everything. (beat) Nurse, we'll do an EKG, followed by Bloods. And can you arranfe a monitored bed for him for tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kate looks on as some kids play in the fountain nearby. She self-consciously smooths a fold in her skirt, then looks at her watch. Beat. She looks down at the brown paper bag of cherries. Suddenly a resigned smile flashes across her face - she's been here before  nothing new. Kate gets up and leaves. We watch her walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sound of a vacuum cleaner. FADE IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open on a close up of Kate's face - it says it all. Kate vacuums her mother's floor. She turns it off and unplugs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Coiling up the cord, Kate puts the vacuum cleaner into a cupboard under the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie comes out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resigned, Kate hugs her mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Ok mum, that's me, I'm done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you stay and have some lunch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't, I've got to go. (beat) Not to pry or anything but why is there a large smoked ham under the stairs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that, yes...It's, um...The neighbour gave it to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The polish neighbour? (beat) So probably not a mass murderer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure you're going to be alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course I will. I'll be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Men, who needs them. Remember we've got Greece to look forward to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kate exits her mother's house and passes Paddy the Postman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate walks off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey stands at a counter in a busy reception area. He has his phone lodged in the crook of his neck. In front of him, lies an open phone directory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The receptionist obliges as Harvey scribbles down a number on an old envelope.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's some sort of Statistics Agency. (listens) Yes. That sounds right. Yes, based out at Heathrow. (listens) Thank you. Hold on. (turns to a receptionist) Miss, could I borrow, your pen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .N.S. BOOTH - DAY A phone rings behind the counter. Oonagh picks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate, stands nearby, holding a clipboard, about to head out onto the floor. She looks at Oonagh. She thinks for a beat, then shakes her head, silently gesturing she not there. Oonagh, a little perplexed goes back on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Kate it's for you. Some guy called Harvey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um, I'm sorry. She's not here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey, phone to ear, thinks for a beat. He knows she's there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oonagh pulls the phone away and gestures again to Kate. Kate shakes her head. Beat. Oonagh reluctantly lifts the phone to her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oonagh hangs up, looking at Kate. Kate shrugs defensively before turning to go. We hold on Kate's `confused' face as she walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, she's busy. (beat) She won't come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey, having hung up, lowers the phone from his ear. He looks around the room. Seated across the way an old man stares back at him. A receptionist arrives with some forms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey signs a form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey glances at the receptionist - she is roughly Kate's age. Just then his phone rings. He picks up hopefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey looks around the room at the lonely figures, waiting. A young boy fidgets. Next to him sits a young man, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey glances back at the old man. The old man continues to stare back. Beat. Something changes in Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey hangs up. A smile breaks across his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If I could just get you to sign these, you'll be all done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Harvey, it's Marvin. Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turns from the counter) Oh, I'm still in London, Marvin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well you get yourself back here my friend. I've got some great news. You were right. The Samuelson account. None of the kids could handle it. They couldn't nail it. They ended up picking one of your old tunes. They want you to come back and update it. (beat) We need you back, Harvey. Your old room's here waiting for you. (beat) Harvey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah, `it's great'. I mean, look, I know when to eat humble pie. So look, hey, when can you get back here? (beat) Harvey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you mean you quit? Harvey, fuck you man, you need us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you know, I don't. As you said, it's my `last chance'. (beat) Look, I gotta go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harvey exits the Hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A taxi pulls up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey gets in as the Taxi speeds away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Heathrow please. As quick as you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .N.S. BOOTH - DAY Aggie, manning the booth, attends to some passengers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taxi pulls up. Harvey hurries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .N.S. BOOTH - DAY Harvey approaches the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aggie eyes Harvey, a little warily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aggie tuts and calls behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oonagh comes out from the office, eyeing Harvey suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Oonagh continues to eye Harvey. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey turns and hurries away. Oonagh and Aggie share a smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me, I'm looking for a Kate. Kate Walker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A friend. (beat) More than a friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a man here looking for Kate, says he's `more than a friend.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're the American. (long beat) She likes you. I can tell. (beat) Now, don't you go messing her around. Don't you hurt her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's left for the day. (beat) But you might find her at her class. (looks at her watch) I think it starts around now. Down on the Southbank. At the National.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh you do, do you? (beat) Well, go on. Go get her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The blood oozes from his wound like dark chocolate on a warm summer's day. Kate sits listening in a daze, as `mild-mannered Mike' unleashes his latest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey alights from the Taxi, paying the driver. He runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone gathers their things as the class wraps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey hurries towards the Southbank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate comes down from the upper terrace of the National, saying her good-byes to her classmates. In her hand she holds a book. As she turns she sees Harvey coming to a stop in the distance. She momentarily falters before approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate can't help but smile. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Kate takes a breath, and gives him the practical response she's gone over in her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A button is pushed in Kate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate turns and walks away, standing by the balustrade, looking down at the river below. Harvey watches. She takes a seat on a bench. Harvey gives her, her space. Then slowly he approaches, leaning against a tree nearby. Long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long beat. Just then Kate's phone rings. She reaches into her bag and takes it out. She stares at the phone, thinking for a beat, before answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hangs up. Long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate can't help but smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Kate collecting herself, looks up at Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate stares at Harvey for the longest while. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Harvey nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate gathers up her things, stands and joins Harvey. They begin to walk. After a short while Kate stops, puts her hand on Harvey's shoulder and takes off her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey glances down at Kate's feet, then up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey and Kate smile. And as they walk away from us we hear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're still here - still in London...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. (beat) Kate, I just wanted to apologise and explain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you don't have to - explain - it's fine -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need to hear - it's fine, seriously.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I want to... (comes out) I had to go to Hospital.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's nothing, I'm fine, I just forgot to take my pills. I have this condition, I've had it since I was a kid - it's an irregular heart- beat sort of thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes! How do you know what it is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling a little sheepish) My...My father has it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Well, young men get it too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT'D (CONT'D) Kate, I'm so sorry I wasn't there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harvey, I like you, I really do. And I had a lovely time - it was great. But, you know, I don't really do fountains at noon. (beat) I live in Willesden. And you live - in -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly. And we're not teenagers, so - you know, monday morning and life kicks in, all that jobs and family and brown envelopes with bills in - it was a lovely day and I won't forget it, but it's not exactly real life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kate, I want this. I want you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it's not just about you, is it? (beat) You don't know anything about me. Look at me. It's pathetic. I expected you not to show for God's sake. I think I even wanted you not to be there, it's easier that way. (beat) You - you just dive in wherever, deep end, whoosh. But, I'm not your bloody swimming pool Harvey. (starting to break) (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I am not going to do it, I'm not going to do it because it will hurt. Not right now, maybe, but soon - there will be a "it's not quite working is it" or a "I need some space" or whatever it is and it'll end and it'll hurt and I won't do it, I won't and...I...Oh fuck, I don't want to cry. I don't want this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it's actually easier for me to be disappointed. I think I'm actually angry at you for trying to take that away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firmly) Mum, I love you, but not now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Should I take that as a hopeful sign?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you just give me a little wider smile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So how's this going to work, Mr Shine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have absolutely no idea... (beat) But it will. (beat) I promise you that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you're my kinda girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you ask me those questions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, from the airport. When I wouldn't stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue
